item.title: Curtis add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Emmett F. Fields
item.description: "Atheism is more than just the knowledge that gods do not exist, and that religion is either a mistake or a fraud. Atheism is an attitude, a frame of mind that looks at the world objectively, fearlessly, always trying to understand all things as a part of nature." -- Emmett F. Fields

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Curtis add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson
